description: From Middle English bifolen, equivalent to be- +‎ fool.

verbs.description: befool (third-person singular simple present befools, present participle befooling, simple past and past participle befooled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To make a fool out of (someone); to fool, trick, or deceive (someone).
examples: Nothing doth so befoole a man as extreme passion; this doth both make them fooles, which otherwise are not; and show them to be fooles that are so  […]
